description: Examination of how the resurgence of competitive, multi-party elections in Africa has reinfused democratic governance and transformed the process of public policy-making. Emphasis on the political landscape of public opinion and voting behavior; elections and political parties; the state and governance; as well as policy-making, with focus on economic and social policies.
title: Democratic Politics and Public...

long_title: Democratic Politics and Public Policy in Contemporary Africa
